question:
Study the given table and answer the questions that follows.

The table shows the results of half-yearly and annual examinations of three sections A, B C of class X students in a school.

Find the failed percentage of section C in at least one of the two examinations.

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image001.png
https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image002.png
solution:
Total students in section C who failed in at least one of the two examinations = 12 + 6 + 8 => 26

Fail percentage = => 42.62%


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image003.png

question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

Ratio of imports to exports from two companies over the years.

In how many of the given years were the imports more than the exports of Company N?

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image004.png
solution:
For company N =>

2005 => Ratio is 1 : 1, it means import and export are same.

2006 => Ratio is 11 : 10, it means import is greater than the export.

2007 => Ration is 13: 10, it means import is greater than the export.

2008 => Ration is 11 : 10, it means import is greater than the export.

2009 => Ratio is 3 : 2, it means import is greater than the export.

2010 => Ration is 1 :1, it means import and export are same.

Therefore, in four years that is in 2006, 2007, 2008 and 2009 the import is greater than the export.

question:
The given table shows the percentage of marks obtained by 5 students in different subject. Study the table and answer the question that follows. (Maximum marks are given beside subject).

The marks obtained by Ram in Botany are less/more than Karn’s marks in Botany by how much?

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image005.png
https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image006.png
solution:
Ram’s marks in Botany = 200 95% = 190

Karn’s marks in Botany = 200 80% = 160

Ram’s marks in Botany is 30 more than that of Karn’s.


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image007.png

question:
Read the given information and answer the question that follows.

The following table gives the percentage of marks obtained by seven students in six different subjects in an examination.

The number in the brackets gives the maximum marks in each subject.

What is the median raw score of the marks obtained by the seven students in Chemistry?

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image008.png
https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image009.png
solution:
Marks obtained in Chemistry = 130×50%, 130×80%, 130×60%, 130×65%, 130×65%, 130×75%, 130×35

65, 104, 78, 84.5, 84.5, 97.5, 45.5

Arranging in ascending order: 45.5, 65, 78, 84.5, 84.5, 97.5, 104

Median = 84.5

question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

The graph shows the profit percentage earned by two companies – A and B over a period of six years.

If the income of the company A in the year 2012 was ₹6.425 lakh, what was its expenditure in that year?

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image010.png
solution:
Income = Expenditure + Profit

Profit percentage of A in the year 2012 = 45%

Income = 145% and Expenditure = 100%

145% => 6.425 lakhs

100% => => ₹4.43 lakhs

Therefore, A’s expenditure in the year 2012 = ₹4.43 lakhs


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image011.png

question:
Study the given graph and answer the question that follows.

The graph shows the profit percentage earned by two companies – A and B over a period of six years.

What is the percentage increase in profit percentage of company B in the year 2014 from the previous year?

[SSC CHSL 2024 T-1]


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1751718950543_image012.png
solution:
Profit % of B in the year 2013 = 44%

Profit % of B in the year 2014 = 50%

% increase = 63%
